intro: Malvastrum burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It has heart-shaped leaves with a soft, hairy texture. Malvastrum burchellii is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
